column9: Initiative from the undisclosed GRI (found by the coder but not mentioned in the GRI index table)

column13: Wesfarmers sources renewable electricity and associated large-scale generation certificates (LGCs) through power purchase agreements and other wholesale agreements with electricity retailers and generators.
column20: Power purchase agreement, renewable electricity, large-scale generation certificate

column13: Wesfarmers sources renewable electricity through retail products such as GreenPower to meet electricity needs in markets with limited options, including for some small sites.

Covalent Lithium is a 50/50 joint venture between Wesfarmers and SQM. Together, Wesfarmers and SQM are investing over $2 billion in the joint venture, which is expected to produce battery-quality lithium hydroxide in Australia in 2025. Since the final investment decision was taken in 2021, Covalent Lithium has managed the construction of a mine and concentrator at Mt Holland, 400 kilometres east of Perth. When fully operational, the mine and concentrator are expected to produce approximately 380,000 tonnes of spodumene concentrate yearly.

Wesfarmers' WesCEF has partnered with Mitsui & Co. Ltd on carbon capture and storage and low-carbon ammonia and with APA Group to assess the feasibility of transporting hydrogen along the southern portion of the Parmelia Gas Pipeline. WesCEF is also part of a consortium developing breakthrough green ammonia technology led by Jupiter Ionics.

By December 2025, suppliers of products containing paper and wood sold and procured by Officeworks must demonstrate that the products are free from deforestation. It can be done via FSC certification, being 100 per cent recycled, made from fast-growing fibres (with evidence they have been harvested legally and sustainably) or by additional due diligence or responsible forestry initiatives the supplier undertakes to ensure no deforestation is associated.

column6: Nitrogen oxides (NOx), sulfur oxides (SOx), and other significant air emissions
Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Wesfarmers' Environment Policy sets out the minimum level of controls and standards required across the Group to ensure compliance with environmental laws, regulatory requirements and licence conditions and demonstrate a commitment to sustainably operate the business.
column20: Environment Policy, environmental law, licence condition

column6: Waste generation and significant waste-related impacts
column13: Wesfarmers' Kmart Group utilised its waste and recycling dashboard to enable stores, regions and states to monitor and compare waste generation, diversion and bin density and deploy site-specific interventions to improve waste diversion. It includes expanding the suite of recycling services available and identifying where education and employee engagement are required to improve recycling outcomes.
column20: Waste and recycling dashboard, waste generation, recycling service

column13: Bunnings and Officeworks currently operate recycling programs to support the recovery of raw materials from products at the end of life, delivering Scope 3 reduction benefits. Other strategies can also reduce Scope 3 emissions by extending product life and reducing upstream resource demand, such as more sustainable product ranges and repurposing and repairing.
column20: Raw materials recovery, recycling program, sustainable product range

column13: With the introduction of Urea Sustain, a coated nitrogen fertiliser, Wesfarmers' CSBP Fertilisers helped to optimise crop nutrient absorption and lower the risk of nutrient loss to the environment. Products like Urea Sustain can improve the emissions intensity of crop production, contributing to the long-term sustainability of this key WA export industry.
column20: Urea Sustain, nitrogen fertiliser, nutrient absorption

column13: From December 2022 to February 2023, Officeworks and Circonomy trialled a 10-week furniture repair program. Throughout the trial, Officeworks successfully diverted 5.5 tonnes and 271 furniture items from landfill. Of the stores that took part in the trial, Officeworks saw reduced time and labour costs for dealing with damaged items. 191 pieces were repaired on-site, and 80 were diverted to Circonomy for resale.

Wesfarmers' Blackwoods continued its partnership with ACT Logistics in recycling and repurposing e-waste. As orders are raised, the Blackwoods Own-Brand industrial workwear range will transition to recyclable polybags with in-built moisture control properties throughout 2023. These polybags are made from 100 per cent recycled content.

NZ Safety Blackwoods reviewed its waste streams within its trade centres. It introduced soft plastic recycling via its waste management provider in 25 of its 32 sites, with ongoing work to implement a solution in the remaining sites. A waste improvement blueprint is under development for all sites to review their waste pickups to improve waste stream management and reduce costs associated with waste.
column20: Waste stream, trade centre, soft plastic recycling

column13: Wesfarmers' Workwear Group developed a packaging standard for all brands, ensuring no plastic clips or kimble tags, only one swing ticket, a recyclable plastic garment bag, recycled product content, and mandatory recycling instructions for packaging. Workwear Group's packaging standard was finalised in May 2023, and the business commenced implementation in June 2023.
column20: Packaging standard, plastic clip, recyclable plastic garment bag

column13: Wesfamers' Bunnings continued to include the Australasian Recycling Label (ARL) on product packaging to help customers dispose of packaging correctly. The ARL was applied to more than 1,000 additional products in the Bunnings range during the year.
column20: Australasian Recycling Label, product packaging, Bunnings

column13: Bunnings introduced a plastic plant pot stewardship program across selected stores in Australia and New Zealand. The program supports the improvement of plastic packaging recycling by inviting customers to return used plant packaging made from polypropylene plastic, which is difficult for many local recycling facilities to process.
column20: Plastic pot stewardship program, plastic packaging, polypropylene plastic

column13: In December 2022, Kmart ran a circular design training pilot with its leadership team, led by circular design specialist Dr Clara Vuletich. Leaders were asked to reimagine Kmart products through a circular lens and consider Kmart in terms of the circular design. This session's findings have helped inform a working group that will create a circular design strategy for Kmart.
column20: Circular design training pilot, leadership team, circular design specialist

column7: Wesfarmers generated 191.8 kilotonnes of waste in 2023.
Wesfarmers recovered 137.3 kilotonnes of waste in 2023.
Wesfarmers disposed of 54.5 kilotonnes of waste in 2023.

column6: Non-compliance with environmental laws and regulations
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
New suppliers that were screened using environmental criteria
column13: Bunnings continued to conduct due diligence to monitor timber supplier performance following its policy. Bunnings' Responsible Timber Sourcing Survey is conducted quarterly by suppliers of new timber, wood or fibre products to Bunnings to capture the timber species, country of harvest, forest type, country of manufacture, applicable timber certification and product claims. It includes component and composite products that have a percentage of timber inputs.
column20: Responsible Timber Sourcing Survey, due diligence, timber supplier

column6: Negative environmental impacts in the supply chain and actions taken
New employee hires and employee turnover
column13: During the year, Bunnings continued offering Indigenous employment programs to support Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates during recruitment and onboarding. A new leadership program was introduced to help Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander team members develop leadership capabilities. The Transition to Work Program also aims to recruit Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people experiencing hardship to transition into permanent and rewarding work at Bunnings.
column20: Indigenous employment, leadership program, leadership capability
